title: An overlooked gem
review:
Director: Michael Stevantoni and Writers: Michael Stevantoni and Tim Rousseau have created a nice gem of a story put to film.

Brian and Ramona have what appears to be a quite life with a charming child. But still waters run deep and a rift between them causes concern for their future and dreams. The Salton Sea becomes a symbolic picture of their current relationship. Can it be saved?

The story, dialog, and acting is believable and spot on for each character. The ending was a bit odd for me.
